## Description {#details}

This file is a part of <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-hwaddresssanitizer-cpp-/hwaddresssanitizer">HWAddressSanitizer</a>, an address basic correctness checker based on tagged addressing.

<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This struct defines the shadow mapping using the rule:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If &#96;kFixed&#96;, then</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   shadow = (mem &gt;&gt; Scale) + Offset.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If &#96;kGlobal&#96;, then</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   extern char&#42; &#95;&#95;hwasan&#95;shadow&#95;memory&#95;dynamic&#95;address;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   shadow = (mem &gt;&gt; Scale) + &#95;&#95;hwasan&#95;shadow&#95;memory&#95;dynamic&#95;address</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If &#96;kIfunc&#96;, then</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   extern char &#95;&#95;hwasan&#95;shadow&#91;&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   shadow = (mem &gt;&gt; Scale) + &amp;&#95;&#95;hwasan&#95;shadow</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If &#96;kTls&#96;, then</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   extern char &#42;&#95;&#95;hwasan&#95;tls;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   shadow = (mem&gt;&gt;Scale) + align&#95;up(&#95;&#95;hwasan&#95;shadow, kShadowBaseAlignment)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If WithFrameRecord is true, then &#95;&#95;hwasan&#95;tls will be used to access the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// ring buffer for storing stack allocations on targets that support it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/passinfomixin">PassInfoMixin&lt;HWAddressSanitizerPass&gt;</a> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">)-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hwaddresssanitizerpass/#aa9b4734b07ef55732d35569201ffefe3">printPipeline</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="normal">  OS &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="charliteral">&#39;&lt;&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Options.CompileKernel)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><Highlight kind="normal">    OS &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;kernel;&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><Highlight kind="normal">  OS &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="charliteral">&#39;&gt;&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HWAddressSanitizer::createHwasanCtorComdat() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::tie(HwasanCtorFunction, std::ignore) =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a717a199ea9514d956fa87fd23c13a228">getOrCreateSanitizerCtorAndInitFunctions</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><Highlight kind="normal">          M, <a href="#a1c31c159d77a06642f58c0cb4945609a">kHwasanModuleCtorName</a>, <a href="#ae445ac6827771eafd730e61f976cba44">kHwasanInitName</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;InitArgTypes=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;&#125;,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;InitArgs=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;&#125;,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This callback is invoked when the functions are created the first</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// time. Hook them into the global ctors list in that case:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="normal">          &#91;&amp;&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42;Ctor, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functioncallee">FunctionCallee</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><Highlight kind="normal">            <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/comdat">Comdat</a> &#42;CtorComdat = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>.getOrInsertComdat(<a href="#a1c31c159d77a06642f58c0cb4945609a">kHwasanModuleCtorName</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><Highlight kind="normal">            Ctor-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalobject/#a800a5183372ed37a74be5cddf5df325c">setComdat</a>(CtorComdat);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><Highlight kind="normal">            <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac030f6d03b674c2d132fd54fb60c9f26">appendToGlobalCtors</a>(M, Ctor, 0, Ctor);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><Highlight kind="normal">          &#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="537"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Create a note that contains pointers to the list of global</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// descriptors. Adding a note to the output file will cause the linker to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// create a PT&#95;NOTE program header pointing to the note that we can use to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// find the descriptor list starting from the program headers. A function</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// provided by the runtime initializes the shadow memory for the globals by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// accessing the descriptor list via the note. The dynamic loader needs to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="543"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// call this function whenever a library is loaded.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="544"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The reason why we use a note for this instead of a more conventional</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="546"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// approach of having a global constructor pass a descriptor list pointer to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="547"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the runtime is because of an order of initialization problem. With</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="548"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// constructors we can encounter the following problematic scenario:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1) library A depends on library B and also interposes one of B&#39;s symbols</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2) B&#39;s constructors are called before A&#39;s (as required for correctness)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 3) during construction, B accesses one of its &quot;own&quot; globals (actually</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    interposed by A) and triggers a HWASAN failure due to the initialization</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="554"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    for A not having happened yet</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="555"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="556"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Even without interposition it is possible to run into similar situations in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="557"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// cases where two libraries mutually depend on each other.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="558"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="559"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We only need one note per binary, so put everything for the note in a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="560"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// comdat. This needs to be a comdat with an .init&#95;array section to prevent</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="561"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// newer versions of lld from discarding the note.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="562"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="563"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Create the note even if we aren&#39;t instrumenting globals. This ensures that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="564"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// binaries linked from object files with both instrumented and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="565"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// non-instrumented globals will end up with a note, even if a comdat from an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="566"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// object file with non-instrumented globals is selected. The note is harmless</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="567"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if the runtime doesn&#39;t support it, since it will just be ignored.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="620"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HWAddressSanitizer::removeFnAttributes(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="621"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Remove memory attributes that are invalid with HWASan.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="622"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// HWASan checks read from shadow, which invalidates memory(argmem: &#42;)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="623"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Short granule checks on function arguments read from the argument memory</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="624"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (last byte of the granule), which invalidates writeonly.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="625"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="626"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is not only true for sanitized functions, because AttrInfer can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// infer those attributes on libc functions, which is not true if those</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="628"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are instrumented (Android) or intercepted.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We might want to model HWASan shadow memory more opaquely to get rid of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="631"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this problem altogether, by hiding the shadow memory write in an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// intrinsic, essentially like in the AArch64StackTagging pass. But that&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for another day.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="634"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="635"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The API is weird. &#96;onlyReadsMemory&#96; actually means &quot;does not write&quot;, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="636"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#96;onlyWritesMemory&#96; actually means &quot;does not read&quot;. So we reconstruct</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="637"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &quot;accesses memory&quot; &amp;&amp; &quot;does not read&quot; &lt;=&gt; &quot;writes&quot;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="638"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/groups/arcopt/#gaa57b1a4e6a1c79233913139635169cf1">Changed</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="639"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>-&gt;doesNotAccessMemory()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1028"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The memaccess fixed shadow intrinsic is only supported on AArch64,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1029"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which allows a 16-bit immediate to be left-shifted by 32</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1030"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since kShadowBaseAlignment == 32, and Linux by default will not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1031"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// mmap above 48-bits, practically any valid shadow offset is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1032"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// representable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1033"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In particular, an offset of 4TB (1024 &lt;&lt; 32) is representable, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1034"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ought to be good enough for anybody.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1035"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (TargetTriple.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/triple/#ad953e410aea43848740978d9a6529a82">isAArch64</a>() &amp;&amp; Mapping.isFixed()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1036"><Highlight kind="normal">    uint16&#95;t OffsetShifted = Mapping.offset() &gt;&gt; 32;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1037"><Highlight kind="normal">    UseFixedShadowIntrinsic =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1038"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">uint64&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(OffsetShifted) &lt;&lt; 32 == Mapping.offset();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1039"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1040"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1041"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (UseFixedShadowIntrinsic) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1256"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1257"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A list of 8-bit numbers that have at most one run of non-zero bits.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1258"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// x = x ^ (mask &lt;&lt; 56) can be encoded as a single armv8 instruction for these</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1259"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// masks.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1260"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The list does not include the value 255, which is used for UAR.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1261"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1262"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Because we are more likely to use earlier elements of this list than later</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1263"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ones, it is sorted in increasing order of probability of collision with a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1264"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// mask allocated (temporally) nearby. The program that generated this list</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1265"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// can be found at:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1266"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// https://github.com/google/sanitizers/blob/master/hwaddress-sanitizer/sort&#95;masks.py</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1267"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> FastMasks&#91;&#93; = &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1268"><Highlight kind="normal">      0,   128, 64, 192, 32,  96,  224, 112, 240, 48, 16,  120,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1269"><Highlight kind="normal">      248, 56,  24, 8,   124, 252, 60,  28,  12,  4,  126, 254,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1270"><Highlight kind="normal">      62,  30,  14, 6,   2,   127, 63,  31,  15,  7,  3,   1&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1271"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> FastMasks&#91;AllocaNo % std::size(FastMasks)&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1371"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Prepare ring buffer data.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1372"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;PC = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/memtag/#ad9b5eba01208d43c3c753251be70778a">memtag::getPC</a>(TargetTriple, IRB);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1373"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64iseldagtodag-cpp/#a2098a5fa6ada61b6c4a1f210ad84e4a1a4ebada6a2af2bcba53ded1d7b414f081">FP</a> = getCachedFP(IRB);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1374"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1375"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Mix FP and PC.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1376"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Assumptions:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1377"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// PC is 0x0000PPPPPPPPPPPP  (48 bits are meaningful, others are zero)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1378"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FP is 18446744073709552000  (4 lower bits are zero)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1379"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We only really need ~20 lower non-zero bits (FFFF), so we mix like this:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1380"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       0xFFFFPPPPPPPPPPPP</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1381"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1382"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FP works because in AArch64FrameLowering::getFrameIndexReference, we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1383"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// prefer FP-relative offsets for functions compiled with HWASan.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1384"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64iseldagtodag-cpp/#a2098a5fa6ada61b6c4a1f210ad84e4a1a4ebada6a2af2bcba53ded1d7b414f081">FP</a> = IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#a9b6a3be6451cf6a789d9305d90751c40">CreateShl</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64iseldagtodag-cpp/#a2098a5fa6ada61b6c4a1f210ad84e4a1a4ebada6a2af2bcba53ded1d7b414f081">FP</a>, 44);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1385"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#ab61be8e3cf17e9848aeeeabacfa1b09a">CreateOr</a>(PC, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64iseldagtodag-cpp/#a2098a5fa6ada61b6c4a1f210ad84e4a1a4ebada6a2af2bcba53ded1d7b414f081">FP</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1736"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SizeInBytes != NewSize) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1742"><Highlight kind="normal">    Initializer = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantstruct/#ab154936bb49a215c32bdbd18254fc477">ConstantStruct::getAnon</a>(&#123;Initializer, Padding&#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1743"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1753"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1754"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It is invalid to ICF two globals that have different tags. In the case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1755"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// where the size of the global is a multiple of the tag granularity the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1756"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// contents of the globals may be the same but the tags (i.e. symbol values)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1757"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// may be different, and the symbols are not considered during ICF. In the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1758"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// case where the size is not a multiple of the granularity, the short granule</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1759"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// tags would discriminate two globals with different tags, but there would</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1760"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// otherwise be nothing stopping such a global from being incorrectly ICF&#39;d</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1761"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with an uninstrumented (i.e. tag 0) global that happened to have the short</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1762"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// granule tag in the last byte.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1763"><Highlight kind="normal">  NewGV-&gt;setUnnamedAddr(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#ae8df4be75bfc50b1eadd74e85c25fa45a6adf97f83acf6453d4a6a4b1070f3754">GlobalValue::UnnamedAddr::None</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1764"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1765"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Descriptor format (assuming little-endian):</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1766"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bytes 0-3: relative address of global</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1767"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bytes 4-6: size of global (16MB ought to be enough for anyone, but in case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1768"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it isn&#39;t, we create multiple descriptors)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1769"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// byte 7: tag</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1770"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;DescriptorTy = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/structtype/#a18fc4545474c6ebb6f7c547f64f4fb31">StructType::get</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a23f9ec4bb2576ca8738f3edc9c4f5cdf">Int32Ty</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a23f9ec4bb2576ca8738f3edc9c4f5cdf">Int32Ty</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1849"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We need to untag stack frames as we unwind past them. That is the job of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1850"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the personality function wrapper, which either wraps an existing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1851"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// personality function or acts as a personality function on its own. Each</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1852"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function that has a personality function or that can be unwound past has</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1853"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// its personality function changed to a thunk that calls the personality</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1854"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function wrapper in the runtime.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
